New Records: Pakistan broke the previous successful chase of 328 set by Ireland when they stunned England at the 2011 World Cup, chasing down a target of 345 in 48.2 overs
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan scored an undefeated 131, Abdullah Shafique made 113, and Kusal Mendis smashed the fastest century for Sri Lanka in a World Cup match on his way to 122, while Sadeera Samarawickrama hit an 89-ball 108
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Rizwan said 'It's always a proud memory when you perform for your country' after claiming his player of the match trophy, while Sri Lanka's captain, Dasun Shanaka, said 'I'm really happy about the way both of the guys played, but we should have finished a bit stronger than this'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan stretched its Cricket World Cup record against Sri Lanka to 8-0, Sri Lanka have had plenty of bowling problems at the World Cup, and the hundreds from Shafique and Rizwan overshadowed Mendis’s 77-ball 122 and Samarawickrama’s 108
Others: The match was played on a perfect batting pitch, Dilshan Madushanka got the key wickets in the powerplay for Sri Lanka, and Pakistan had a sluggish start to the chase
